definitions: To return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
To get back or regain (something lost or stolen).
To retrieve or save (data or a file) after a system failure.
To make up for or regain (lost time, money, etc.).
examples: She is recovering from a serious illness.
Police managed to recover the stolen jewels.
I need to recover the deleted files.
We worked extra hours to recover lost ground.
